payload.description:
An application-specific JSON object. HERE Tracking doesn't read this object but
you can use it to pass information to other applications. The maximum size is 1000B.

position.description: The reported or determined location of the device

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

confidence.description: Confidence level in percent for the accuracy/uncertainty. If not specified, the default is 68 (this corresponds to a 68% probability that the true position is within the accuracy/uncertainty radius of the position; the higher the number, the greater the confidence level).

floor.description: The building where the measurements were taken

level.description: The floor in the building in integer format

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

wlancount.description: The total number of observed WLAN APs in the scan used for producing the position. ("wlan" position type only)

scan.description: Radio measurements used for positioning or radio map contribution.

items.description: Bluetooth measurement. In addition to rss, one of mac, eddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

eddystoneId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 10-byte Namespace component and a 6-byte Instance component

iBeaconId.description: Full Identifier as Base64 string. A combination of 16-byte UUID + 2-byte major + 2-byte minor

mac.description: The MAC address of the Bluetooth access point. MAC-48 address with colon (:) or hyphen (-) separators, upper or lower case hex digits. For privacy reasons positioning based on a single Bluetooth AP is not possible; there has to be at least one other matching WLAN or Bluetooth access point. Either MAC, EddystoneId, or iBeaconId is required.

rss.description: Received signal strength (dBm) at the terminal

channel.description: CDMA channel frequency (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pnoffset)

pilotpower.description: Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

Pilot Power (dBm) (Optional). If Pilot Power is not available directly, it needs to be calculated from Total Power in the band and Pilot Strength with respect to the Total Power. Pilot power less than -142dBm should be mapped to -142. Pilot power greater than -49dBm should be mapped to -49.

pnoffset.description: Pseudonoise offset (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for channel)

country.description: Indicates in which country the WLAN APs are located (in case cell data is not present in radio_observations)

gps.description:
Optionally supply this to improve HERE Tracking's positioning service by
contributing the scan data along with a GPS position.

accuracy.description: Uncertainty circle radius in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

alt.description: Altitude in meters (referenced to the WGS-84 ellipsoid) negative or positive.

altaccuracy.description: Uncertainty of the altitude estimate in meters (degree of confidence according to the 'confidence' parameter).

heading.description: GPS/GNSS heading in degrees, clockwise from true north. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for speed.

lat.description: Latitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -90 to 90.

lng.description: Longitude in WGS-84 format, decimal representation ranging from -180 to 180.

satellitecount.description: Number of GPS/GNSS satellites used for the calculation of the position fix. ("gnss" position type only)

speed.description: GPS/GNSS speed of the device (m/s). Position fixes at speed above the maximum should not be used for contribution. You must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for heading.

bcch.description: Broadcast Control Channel (Synonymous to ARFCN = Absolute Radio Frequency Channel) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for bsic).

bsic.description: Base Station Identity Code (for instance, color code) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for bcch).

cid.description: Cell Identifier, 16 bits. Mcc+mnc+lac+cid uniquely identifies the GSM cell.

bcch.description: Broadcast Control Channel (Synonymous to ARFCN = Absolute Radio Frequency Channel)

bsic.description: Base Station Identity Code (for instance, color code)

rxlevel.description: Received Signal power (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -110dBm should be mapped to -110. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.
Received Signal power (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -110dBm should be mapped to -110. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

ta.description: Timing advance (Optional). Expressed in the units of GSM bits equaling to 48/13 Î¼s ~ 1107 meters.

cid.description: E-UTRA Cell Identifier, 28 bits (20 bits eNodeB and 8 bits Cell id). Mcc+mnc+cid uniquely identifies the LTE cell, tac is optional.

earfcn.description: Evolved Absolute Radio Frequency Channel (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pci)

rsrp.description: Reference Signal Received Power = RSRP (dBm) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for rsrq). Power less than -140dBm should be mapped to -140. Power greater than -44dBm should be mapped to -44.

rsrq.description: Reference Signal Received Quality = RSRQ (dB) (Optional). Values less than -19.5dB should be mapped to -19.5, and values greater than -3dB should be mapped to -3dB.

pci.description: Physical Cell Identity (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for earfcn)

rsrp.description: Reference Signal Received Power = RSRP (dBm) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for rsrq). Power less than -140dBm should be mapped to -140. Power greater than -44dBm should be mapped to -44.

rsrq.description: Reference Signal Received Quality = RSRQ (dB) (Optional). Values less than -19.5dB should be mapped to -19.5, and values greater than -3dB should be mapped to -3dB.

ta.description: Timing Advance (Optional). Expressed in the units of 16*Ts (16 Basic time units) = 16/(15000*2048) seconds ~ 156meters. For reference see TS 36.213 and 36.211.

cellparams.description: Cell Parameters ID (CDMA Spreading Code ID) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for uarfcn).

cid.description: UTRAN Cell Identifier, 28 bits (12 bits RNC and 16 bits Cell id). Mcc+mnc+cid uniquely identifies the TDSCDMA cell, lac is optional.

nmr.description: Network measurements (Optional). Maximum of 8 uarfcndl times maximum of 32 psc.

cellparams.description: Cell Parameters ID (CDMA Spreading Code ID)

pathloss.description: UTRAN path loss (dB) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for rscp).

rscp.description: Received Signal Code Power = RSCP (dBm) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pathloss). Power less than -120dBm should be mapped to -120. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

uarfcn.description: Carrier frequency of a UTRA-TDD Serving Cell

pathloss.description: UTRAN path loss (dB) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for rscp).

rscp.description: Received Signal Code Power = RSCP (dBm) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for pathloss). Power less than -120dBm should be mapped to -120. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

ta.description: Timing advance (Optional). Round-Trip distance presented in the units of 4*c/7.68e6 ~156 meters. That is, the scaling factor is 4 times the chip length at chip rate of 7.68 Mchips/s. Note that at chip rates 1.28 Mchips/s and 3.84 Mchips/s you need to scale according to chip length of 7.68 Mchips/s, that is, multiply by 6 or 2 if needed.

uarfcn.description: Carrier frequency of a UTRA-TDD Serving Cell (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for cellparams).

cid.description: UTRAN Cell Identifier, 28 bits (12 bits RNC and 16 bits Cell id). Mcc+mnc+cid uniquely identifies the WCDMA cell, lac is optional.

nmr.description: Network measurements (Optional). Maximum of 8 uarfcndl times maximum of 32 psc.

psc.description: Primary Scrambling Code (Primary CPICH, Primary Control Pilot Channel)

rscp.description: Received Signal Code Power = RSCP (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -120dBm should be mapped to -120. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

uarfcndl.description: Downlink frequency of a UTRA-FDD Serving Cell

psc.description: Primary Scrambling Code (Primary CPICH, Primary Control Pilot Channel) (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for uarfcndl).

rscp.description: Received Signal Code Power = RSCP (dBm) (Optional). Power less than -120dBm should be mapped to -120. Power greater than -25dBm should be mapped to -25.

uarfcndl.description: Downlink frequency of a UTRA-FDD Serving Cell (Optional, you must specify a value for this item when you specify a value for psc).

band.description: Frequency range (GHz). Allowed values are 2.4, 3.65, and 5. (Possible future values include 4.9, 5.9, 60, and 900.)

mac.description: The MAC address of the WLAN access point. MAC-48 address with colon (:) or hyphen (-) separators, upper or lower case hex digits. Note that if the SSID contains postfix "_nomap", the AP should not be used for positioning. For privacy reasons positioning based on a single WLAN AP is not possible; there has to be at least one other matching wlan or cell.

powrx.description: Received signal level (dBm) at the terminal (Optional)

system.description:
Values within the device configuration that are used by HERE Tracking for
various application flows.

This object can be read by HERE Tracking whereas the content of the payload is
opaque.

stateVersion can be provided by the device, denoting the version of the last
known desired state seen by the device.

homenetwork.description: Information about subscriber home network - 3GPP MCC+MNC or 3GPP2 SID+NID. Dual-SIM devices can provide information on both two subscriptions.

items.description: Network information. Either MCC + MNC or SID + NID attribute pair is required.

name.description: Name of the client software accessing the HERE API

platform.description: Software platform information of the device, for example operating system name and version.

version.description: Version of the client software in format X.Y.Z, where X [0..255] is a major, Y [0..255] is a minor, and Z [0..65535] is a build version number. Increase the version/build number for each release of the client.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the device's SIM card in the international E.164 format. You should prefix all country codes with "+" instead of "00".

stateVersion.description: The version of the state of a device. This should be incremented only by HERE Tracking.

timestamp.description:
Milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

This describes when the reported measurements were taken.

If the device does not provide a timestamp, Here Tracking writes its own system time
here at ingestion time.
